payload.text:
**Adjusting SectionWrapper for dark mode**

I'm planning to update SectionWrapper's default background and text colors to use theme tokens like `bg-background` and `text-foreground` to support dark mode better, while ensuring transitions and preserving existing overrides. Since SectionWrapper is widely used and currently defaults to `bg-red-100`, I'll also revise FeatureListSection to pass a className so it can customize backgrounds properly without breaking other sections. This way, dark mode adaptation can be consistent yet flexible across components.

summary.text:
**Adjusting SectionWrapper for dark mode**

I'm planning to update SectionWrapper's default background and text colors to use theme tokens like `bg-background` and `text-foreground` to support dark mode better, while ensuring transitions and preserving existing overrides. Since SectionWrapper is widely used and currently defaults to `bg-red-100`, I'll also revise FeatureListSection to pass a className so it can customize backgrounds properly without breaking other sections. This way, dark mode adaptation can be consistent yet flexible across components.

     <section
       data-anim="pane"
       className={cn(
-        "py-16 px-4 sm:px-3 lg:px-8 bg-red-100 transition-colors dark:bg-neutral-950",
+        "py-16 px-4 sm:px-3 lg:px-8 bg-background text-foreground transition-colors",
         className,
       )}
     >
 
*** End Patch

payload.message:
Dark-mode styling now pulls from the design tokens so the section inherits the correct foreground/background colors in both themes (`packages/ui/shadcn/components/SectionWrapper.tsx:17`). This keeps the FeatureListSection text and cards consistent after toggling dark mode, while still letting per-section overrides win when they‚Äôre provided.

You may want to 1) run your Storybook or app and toggle dark mode to confirm the visual match, or 2) tweak individual section overrides if any should keep a custom tint.

payload.message:
Adjusted the feature cards to respect dark mode by switching their surface/text to the theme tokens and giving the icon badge a dark-aware tint (`packages/ui/shadcn/components/section/FeatureListSection.tsx:79`). Cards now inherit `bg-card`/`text-card-foreground`, and the badge keeps contrast in both themes with `dark:bg-primary/20`.

You might want to 1) reload the gapyear page, toggle dark mode, and confirm the new colors feel consistent, or 2) tweak the border/opacity levels if you‚Äôd like a stronger or softer contrast.

content.text:
Adjusted the feature cards to respect dark mode by switching their surface/text to the theme tokens and giving the icon badge a dark-aware tint (`packages/ui/shadcn/components/section/FeatureListSection.tsx:79`). Cards now inherit `bg-card`/`text-card-foreground`, and the badge keeps contrast in both themes with `dark:bg-primary/20`.

You might want to 1) reload the gapyear page, toggle dark mode, and confirm the new colors feel consistent, or 2) tweak the border/opacity levels if you‚Äôd like a stronger or softer contrast.
